intro: Sphaeralcea arenaria, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing, herbaceous annual or perennial that thrives in sandy and gravelly soils. The plant produces clusters of small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Sphaeralcea arenaria is often found in coastal dunes and inland deserts, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
